\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{portchoice.design.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PortDesign}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ATTLIST}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{NCS}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Experimental design class

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is the class to create experimental designs for portfolio choice
models.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ATTLIST}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List that contains the specification of each alternative of the
experiment. Each element is a dictionary, in which each element
is an attribute. The keys of each element are the attribute names
and each value is a list that contains the attribute levels.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{NCS}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of choice situations.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate experimental design

\sphinxAtStartPar
It generates an experimental design based on the specification
of the parent class and the parameters provided by the user.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ITERLIM}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Iteration limit, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{NOIMPROVLIM}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Limit of iterations without improvement, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{TIMELIM}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Time limit in minutes, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{CRIT}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Efficiency criterion. If \sphinxtitleref{maxcorr}, then the algorithm minimises
the maximum value of the correlation between attributes. If \sphinxtitleref{deff},
the algorithm maximises the D\sphinxhyphen{}efficiency of a linear model, by default ‘deff’

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{COND}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Conditions between attributes of the design. See the examples for an overview
, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{SEED}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Random seed, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{VERBOSE}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Whether the algorithm prints output while optimising, by default True

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{bestdes} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{np.ndarray}) \textendash{} Optimal design

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{perf} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Value of the efficiency criterion at the \sphinxstylestrong{first} iteration

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{bestperf} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Value of the efficiency criterion at the \sphinxstylestrong{last} iteration

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{elapsed\_time} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Optimisation time

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{best\_t} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{int}) \textendash{} Number of iterations

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{PortGen (class in portchoice.generate)@\spxentry{PortGen}\spxextra{class in portchoice.generate}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/portchoice.generate:portchoice.generate.PortGen}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{portchoice.generate.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PortGen}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{V}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{C}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}ndarray\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{delta\_0}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{B}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Portfolio choice data generator class.

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class generates synthetic choices of a portfolio choice model. It
takes the utility of each individual alternative and generates synthetic
choices and the ‘true’ log\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood function. \sphinxtitleref{PortGen} allows for
unconstrained and constrained choice situations (i.e., with resource
constraints).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{V}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Array of deterministic utilities of each individual alternative.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{C}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Array of costs of each individual alternative, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{delta\_0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Parameter of the marginal utility of non\sphinxhyphen{}spent resources. Must be
different from None if \sphinxtitleref{C} is defined, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{B}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Available resources. Must be different from None if \sphinxtitleref{C} is defined,
by default None

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{get\_choices() (portchoice.generate.PortGen method)@\spxentry{get\_choices()}\spxextra{portchoice.generate.PortGen method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/portchoice.generate:portchoice.generate.PortGen.get_choices}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_choices}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate portfolio synthetic choices and log\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It takes the configurations parameters of \sphinxtitleref{PortGen} and generates
a \sphinxtitleref{numpy} array that contains the pseudo\sphinxhyphen{}synthetic choices for
each observation. Additionally, it returns the ‘true’ log\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{y} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{numpy.ndarray}) \textendash{} A \sphinxtitleref{numpy} array with the synthetic choices for each observation.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ll} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} The ‘true’ log\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}


\sphinxstepscope

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/portchoice.models:portchoice.models.PortLogit}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{portchoice.models.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{PortLogit}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{Y}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{DataFrame}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{X}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}DataFrame\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{Z}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}DataFrame\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{C}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}DataFrame\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{B}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Portfolio logit model class.

\sphinxAtStartPar
It contains the routines to prepare the data and estimate a portfolio
logit model, as well as for the computation of the optimal portfolio.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) \textendash{} A data frame with choices of each alternative for each respondent.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{X}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} A data frame with the alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific variables
(e.g., attributes), by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Z}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} A data frame with the individual\sphinxhyphen{}specific variables, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{C}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} A data frame with the costs of each individual alternative for each
respondent, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{B}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Resource constraint, by default None

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{estimate() (portchoice.models.PortLogit method)@\spxentry{estimate()}\spxextra{portchoice.models.PortLogit method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/portchoice.models:portchoice.models.PortLogit.estimate}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{estimate}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{startv}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{asc}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{ndarray}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{beta\_j}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}ndarray\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{delta\_0}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{hess}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{tol}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{float}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{1e\sphinxhyphen{}06}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Estimate portfolio logit model

\sphinxAtStartPar
It starts the optimisation routine of the portfolio logit model.
The user can specify the presence of alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific constants
(\sphinxtitleref{asc}), separate parameters for the alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific variables
(\sphinxtitleref{beta\_j}) and the presence of a parameter that captures the marginal
utility of non\sphinxhyphen{}spent resources (\sphinxtitleref{delta\_0}).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{startv}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Starting values for the maximum\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood estimation routine.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{asc}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} An array of length \sphinxtitleref{n\_alternatives}, in which each element can
be either equal to one if the ASC of the corresponding alternative
is estimated, and zero otherwise.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{beta\_j}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} An array of dimension \sphinxtitleref{n\_alternatives*n\_attributes}, in which each
element can be either equal to one if the corresponding
alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific parameter is estimated, and zero otherwise.
If \sphinxtitleref{beta\_j = None} and \sphinxtitleref{X} exists then single attribute\sphinxhyphen{}specific
parameters (i.e., equal across alternatives) are estimated
, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{delta\_0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} If None and \sphinxtitleref{C} exists, then the parameter of the marginal utility
of non\sphinxhyphen{}spent resources is estimated. If \sphinxtitleref{delta\_0} is a float, then
the parameter is fixed to the value of \sphinxtitleref{delta\_0}, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{hess}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Whether the finite\sphinxhyphen{}difference hessian is estimated at the end of the
estimation routine, by default True

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{tol}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Tolerance of the gradient in the estimation routine, by default 1e\sphinxhyphen{}6

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Whether the estimation routine returns information at each iteration.
See the documentation of \sphinxtitleref{scipy.optimize.minimize} with method
\sphinxtitleref{l\sphinxhyphen{}bfgs\sphinxhyphen{}b} for more information, by default True

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ll} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Log\sphinxhyphen{}likelihood function at the optimum

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{coef} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{numpy.ndarray}) \textendash{} Estimated parameters at the optimum

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{se} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{numpy.ndarray}) \textendash{} Standard errors of \sphinxtitleref{coef}. If \sphinxtitleref{hess = False} then \sphinxtitleref{se = 0.}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{hessian} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{numpy.ndarray}) \textendash{} Finite\sphinxhyphen{}difference Hessian. If \sphinxtitleref{hess = False} then \sphinxtitleref{hessian = 0.}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{diff\_time} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Estimation time in seconds.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/portchoice.models:portchoice.models.PortLogit.optimal_portfolio}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{optimal\_portfolio}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{X}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}Series\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{Z}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}DataFrame\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{C}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}Series\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{B}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}float\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{sims}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{1000}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Compute the optimal portfolio

\sphinxAtStartPar
Computes the optimal portfolio based on the estimation results
(i.e., obtained from \sphinxtitleref{estimate()}) and user\sphinxhyphen{}defined variables.
The optimal portfolio is computed by computing the expected
utility of all possible combinations of alternatives. The
expected utility is computed by simulation using \sphinxtitleref{sims} error
draws from an Extreme Value (Gumbel) distribution.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{X}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.Series}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Series of alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific variables, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Z}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Data frame with individual\sphinxhyphen{}specific variables, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{C}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.Series}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Series with individual costs per alternative, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{B}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Resource constraint, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sims}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Number of Extreme Value random draws, by default 1000

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{portfolio} \textendash{} Data frame with the optimal portfolio (ranked combinations),
its expected utility and its total cost (if \sphinxtitleref{C} is not None).

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
pd.DataFrame

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
